titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Mount Vernon Seminary and College Foxhall Road Campus Collection, 1946-1999 MVC0006.RG
titlestmt.author: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-05-18 14:44:48 -0400.

repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.unittitle: Mount Vernon Seminary and College Foxhall Road Campus Collection
did.abstract: This collection contains photographs, negatives, contact sheets, as well as various press releases, minutes, and correspondence documenting the campus, students, and staff of Mount Vernon Seminary and College during the period from 1946 to 1999 when it was located on Foxhall Road.
did.physloc: Materials may be stored off-site, and may require additional retrieval time. Please contact the Special Collections Research Center for more information.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two series: images and documents.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Mount Vernon Seminary and Junior College moved from its Nebraska Avenue location in 1942 to make way for the United States Navy, and remained in temporary quarters in the Spring Valley neighborhood until 1946, when it reopened at 2100 Foxhall Road. This collection documents the Foxhall Road campus with photos of students, campus events, and buildings from 1946 to 1999, when the college and its campus became part of The George Washington University. It also includes some documents such as minutes, correspondence, and clippings that date as early as 1940.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains photographs, negatives, contact sheets, as well as various press releases, minutes, and correspondence documenting the campus, students, and staff of Mount Vernon Seminary and College during the period from 1946 to 1999 when it was located on Foxhall Road. Images include publicity photos, formal photos of students, snapshots by students and staff, and photos of commencement, student activities, and alumnae activities. Documents, some of which date to 1940, include faculty meeting minutes, some administrative correspondence, pamphlets, programs, press releases, and promotional materials.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Collection acquired by GWU upon merger with Mount Vernon College. Collection transferred to Foggy Bottom campus in 2009.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:
Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository.

Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: There are many collections from the Mount Vernon Archives that contains similar topics and types of content to that found within this collection. Please use http://library.gwu.edu/scrc/search/finding-aids-by-topic/mount-vernon-seminary-and-college for a complete list.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Several boxes were added at later dates, so the contents of those boxes were separately arranged in chronological order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains photographs, negatives, and contacts sheets documenting the campus, students, and staff of Mount Vernon Seminary and College during the period from 1946 to 1999 when it was located on Foxhall Road. They include publicity photos, formal photos of students, snapshots by students and staff, and photos of commencement, student activities, and alumnae activities.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Several boxes were added at later dates, so the contents of those boxes were separately arranged in chronological order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains documents detailing the history of Mount Vernon Seminary and College from 1946 through 1999 during the years when the college was located on Foxhall Road. It contains faculty meeting minutes (some of which date to 1940), some administrative correspondence, pamphlets, programs, and promotional materials.
